thread.title: Thousands in Boston protest Trump's immigration order
thread.title_full: Thousands in Boston protest Trump's immigration order

author: Associated Press
title: Thousands in Boston protest Trump's immigration order
text:
Associated Press Sunday, January 29, 2017 Credit: Nicolaus Czarnecki Thousands gather in Copley Square to rally against the recent Muslim ban, in Boston, on Sunday, January 29, 2017. Staff Photo by Nicolaus Czarnecki comments 
BOSTON â€” Thousands of protesters have gathered in Boston to call for an end to President Donald Trump's order banning travelers from seven Muslim-majority nations. 
Demonstrators filled Copley Square in Boston on Sunday afternoon to protest Trump's order and his pledge to build a wall along the U.S. border with Mexico. 
Protesters carried signs supporting Muslims and other immigrants. One sign held by a young child said: "Don't Ban My Grandma and Grandpa." 
Another protester took direct aim at Trump with a sign that read: "Your comb-over doesn't cover your xenophobia." 
Attendees included U.S. Sens. Elizabeth Warren and Ed Markey of Massachusetts and Boston Mayor Martin Walsh. 
Walsh said in a tweet that the city is standing strong "to support & protect ALL of our people & we will not back down." Related Articles
